ramp noun [C]
(PLANT)
[ usually plural ] a North American wild plant of the allium family (= that includes onions and garlic), which has a strong taste and smell and can be eaten: Ramps are a sign of spring in the eastern mountain states of West Virginia, Kentucky and Tennessee. The North American plant allium tricoccum, known as ramps, is related to the European wild garlic, allium ursinum. The humble ramp has become very much part of our food culture. Compare
wild garlic

a surface connecting a higher and a lower level; a slope: Wide ramps flanked the stairs at the entrance.
A ramp is also a road that lets you drive onto or leave a large road, such as an expressway: an entrance/exit ramp
